item.title: TREE O/S 151 is DANGEROUS TREE, 16th September
item.description:
Resident reporting the tree o/s No 151 is a tall lime tree the pavement has risen & now cracked and the tree trunk is also cracking it has huge cracks the stormy weather can bring it down causing an injury, the tree is leaning towards No 151 and resident is extremely worried in the gales and the bad weather. Please could someone look into this asap please and resident would like to get the tree removed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Axminster Crescent, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Urgent Request for Clean-Up – King Hall Road to Clock House Station, 16th September
item.description:
I’m writing to raise concerns about the alleyway running from the King Hall Road end up to Clock House Station. The area has become severely overgrown with weeds and is littered with rubbish. It appears that no maintenance has taken place for several months. This pathway is regularly used by pedestrians, and its current condition poses safety risks—especially in poor lighting or wet weather, where overgrowth and litter can lead to slips, trips, or other accidents. It also creates an unpleasant environment for the community. I kindly urge the management team to inspect the area and arrange for a clean-up as soon as possible. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Percy Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet
